itemDescription: British swimmer, Olympic athlete, world record-holder

wikipedia_page.main: Daisy Curwen (6 December 1889 – 25 June 1982) was a former British swimmer world record holder in the 100 m freestyle. Curwen competed at the 1912 Summer Olympics in Stockholm, but could not start in the final race any more due to an appendectomy during the event. She was born in Liverpool, Merseyside.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1912 Summer Olympics
Swimming at the 1912 Summer Olympics – Women's 100 metre freestyle
response: Belle Moore, swimming in the first heat, set the first Olympic record with 1 minute 29.8 seconds. In the second heat Daisy Curwen bettered the record with 1 minute 23.6 seconds, and in the fourth heat Fanny Durack set a new world record with 1 minute 19.8 seconds.
